conversation.content: I need to discuss duplicate charges on my PADI instructor certification renewal. Both transactions posted to my account yesterday.
I understand your concern about the duplicate charges. Let me pull up your account right away. May I have your instructor number and the last four digits of the card you used?
My instructor number is 287451. The card ends in 3967.
Thank you. I've located your account under instructor ID 287451. I can see two identical charges of $485.00 that posted yesterday at 2:14 PM and 2:16 PM Eastern time.
Exactly. I need this resolved quickly as I have students scheduled for certification dives this weekend.

I completely understand the urgency given your upcoming certification dives. The good news is I can reverse the duplicate charge immediately. The credit of $485.00 will post to your account within 24 to 48 hours.
Will I receive confirmation of this reversal? I need documentation for my records.
Absolutely. I'm generating a reversal confirmation document now with reference number REF-2024-11387-DUP. You'll receive an email within the next 10 minutes to your registered address.
Good. Can you also verify that my certification renewal was properly processed despite this billing error?
Certainly.
And when will my new certification card arrive?
Your renewal is fully active in our system as of yesterday. Your new physical certification card will arrive at 4521 Coastal Highway, Suite 12B within 5 to 7 business days via priority mail.
That address is outdated. I moved my dive shop to a new location three months ago.
I apologize for that oversight. Let me update your address immediately. Please provide your current business address and I'll ensure your certification card is redirected.
The new address is 1890 Marina Boulevard, Building C, same city and zip code.
Perfect. I've updated your primary business address to 1890 Marina Boulevard, Building C. I'm also expediting a replacement card to this address at no charge, which should arrive by Friday.
Excellent. Will this address update apply to all future PADI correspondence and renewals?
Yes, I've updated it across all systems. Your profile now shows 1890 Marina Boulevard, Building C as your primary contact address for all PADI communications, renewals, and shipments going forward.
Thank you for handling this efficiently. This resolves all my concerns today.

You're very welcome. Just to summarize, we've reversed the duplicate charge of $485.00, expedited your certification card to your new address, and updated your profile. Is there anything else I can assist you with today?

scenario: scuba instructor, worried about certification renewal charges that appear to have posted twice
